title: gt_theme_excel
text:
gt_theme_excel(gt, color='lightgrey')
Applies an Excel-inspired theme to a GT table.
This function styles a GT object with a look inspired by Microsoft Excel tables.

title: gt_theme_espn
text:
gt_theme_espn(gt)
Applies an ESPN-inspired theme to a GT table.
This function styles a GT object with a look inspired by ESPN’s data tables.

title: gt_theme_nytimes
text:
gt_theme_nytimes(gt)
Applies a New York Times-inspired theme to a GT table.
This function styles a GT object with a look inspired by New York Times tables.

title: gt_theme_guardian
text:
gt_theme_guardian(gt)
Applies a Guardian-inspired theme to a GT table.
This function styles a GT object with a look inspired by The Guardian’s data tables.

title: gt_theme_dark
text:
gt_theme_dark(gt)
Applies a dark mode theme to a GT table.
This function styles a GT object with a dark background and light text.

title: gt-extras
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: About
text: About this site

title: gt_theme_dot_matrix
text:
gt_theme_dot_matrix(gt, color='#b5dbb6')
Applies a dot-matrix-inspired theme to a GT table.
This function styles a GT object with a look reminiscent of dot-matrix printouts.

title: API Reference
text:
Functions to generate themes.



gt_theme_538
Applies a FiveThirtyEight-inspired theme to a GT table.

Applies an ESPN-inspired theme to a GT table.


gt_theme_guardian
Applies a Guardian-inspired theme to a GT table.


gt_theme_nytimes
Applies a New York Times-inspired theme to a GT table.


gt_theme_excel
Applies an Excel-inspired theme to a GT table.


gt_theme_dot_matrix
Applies a dot-matrix-inspired theme to a GT table.


gt_theme_dark
Applies a dark mode theme to a GT table.


gt_theme_pff
Applies a Pro Football Focus (PFF)-inspired theme to a GT table.









gt_highlight_cols
Add color highlighting to one or more specific columns.

title: gt_theme_pff
text:
gt_theme_pff(gt, divider=None, spanners=None, rank_col=None)
Applies a Pro Football Focus (PFF)-inspired theme to a GT table.
This function styles a GT object with a look inspired by Pro Football Focus tables, supporting custom spanners, dividers, and rank column highlighting.

title: gt_theme_538
text:
gt_theme_538(gt)
Applies a FiveThirtyEight-inspired theme to a GT table.
This function styles a GT object with a look inspired by the FiveThirtyEight (538) website.

title: gt_highlight_cols
text:
gt_highlight_cols(
    gt,
    columns=None,
    fill='#80bcd8',
    alpha=None,
    font_weight='normal',
    font_color='#000000',
)
Add color highlighting to one or more specific columns.
The gt_highlight_cols() function takes an existing GT object and adds highlighting color to the cell background of a specific column(s).

title: gt_highlight_cols
text:
Parameters









Name
Type
Description
Default




gt
GT
An existing GT object.
required


columns
SelectExpr
The columns to target. Can either be a single column name or a series of column names provided in a list. If None, the alignment is applied to all columns.
None


fill
str
A character string indicating the fill color. If nothing is provided, then "#80bcd8" (light blue) will be used as a default.
'#80bcd8'


alpha
int | None
An integer [0, 1] for the alpha transparency value for the color as single value in the range of 0 (fully transparent) to 1 (fully opaque). If not provided the fill color will either be fully opaque or use alpha information from the color value if it is supplied in the "#RRGGBBAA" format.
None


font_weight
Literal['normal', 'bold', 'bolder', 'lighter'] | int
A string or number indicating the weight of the font. Can be a text-based keyword such as "normal", "bold", "lighter", "bolder", or, a numeric value between 1 and 1000, inclusive. Note that only variable fonts may support the numeric mapping of weight.
'normal'


font_color
str
A character string indicating the text color. If nothing is provided, then "#000000" (black) will be used as a default.
'#000000'

title: gt_highlight_cols
text:
Returns








Name
Type
Description





GT
The GT object is returned. This is the same object that the method is called on so that we can facilitate method chaining.

title: gt_highlight_cols
text:
Examples

from great_tables import GT, md
from great_tables.data import gtcars
import gt_extras as gte

gtcars_mini = gtcars[["model", "year", "hp", "trq"]].head(5)

gt = (
    GT(gtcars_mini, rowname_col="model")
    .tab_stubhead(label=md("*Car*"))
)

gte.gt_highlight_cols(gt, columns="hp")

alpha: None, fill: #80bcd8, fill-with-alpha: #80bcd8








Car
year
hp
trq




GT

550.0


458 Speciale
2015

458 Spider
2015

398.0

title: gt_theme_pff
text:
Parameters









Name
Type
Description
Default




gt
GT
An existing GT object.
required


divider
str | None
Zero or more column names to visually divide with a preceding border.
None


spanners
list[str] | None
Optional list of spanners to style, as referenced by the GT spanner ids.
None


rank_col
str | None
Optional single column name to highlight as a rank column.
None

title: gt_theme_pff
text:
Returns








Name
Type
Description





GT
The themed GT object, allowing for method chaining.

title: gt_theme_538
text:
Examples

from great_tables import GT, md
from great_tables.data import gtcars
import gt_extras as gte

gtcars_mini = gtcars[["model", "year", "hp", "trq"]].head(5)

gt = (
    GT(gtcars_mini, rowname_col="model")
    .tab_stubhead(label=md("*Car*"))
    .tab_header(title="Car Collection")
)

gt.pipe(gte.gt_theme_538)
